@mekkaokereke

True story: In the late 80s in rural upstate New York I went to the drive-in theater with a bunch of friends. There was enough of us we took two cars.

During the double feature we spent around four hours passing the bong back and forth between the cars, laughing and generally being rowdy young people.

The next day the loss prevention officer at the drug store where I worked asked me if I'd done anything the night before... just basic friendly break room chat.

I mentioned the drive-in, at which point he burst out laughing - "I thought that was you!" He and a STATE TROOPER friend were parked behind us, watching our very illegal frivolity. They laughed it off, and that was the end of the conversation.

Every time I see someone dismissing or downplaying white privilege, I think of this story. If I had been arrested then, my life and career prospects would have been destroyed.

See https://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1888864,00.html for an idea of what drug laws were like in NY in the 80s.

How pre-colonial “Filipinos” used numbers. Let's use dates as an example.

#ISO #date: 2023-01-27

Pre-colonial #Tagalog: maikatlong pito sa unang buwan sa taong dalawang libong maikatlong tatlo.

Modern Tagalog: sa ika-dalawampu't pito sa unang buwan sa taong dalawang libo at ika-dalawampu't tatlo.

In #Filipino: ika-dalawampu't pito sa unang buwan sa taong dalawang libo't dalawampu't tatlo.

In #Baybayin (pre-colonial Tagalog): ᜋᜁᜃᜎᜓ ᜉᜒᜆᜓ ᜐ ᜂᜈ ᜊᜓᜏ ᜐ ᜆᜂ ᜇᜎᜏ ᜎᜒᜊᜓ ᜋᜁᜃᜎᜓ ᜆᜎᜓ᜶

In Baybayin with virama (pre-colonial Tagalog): ᜋᜁᜃᜆ᜔ᜎᜓᜅ᜔ ᜉᜒᜆᜓ ᜐ ᜂᜈᜅ᜔ ᜊᜓᜏᜈ᜔ ᜐ ᜆᜂᜅ᜔ ᜇᜎᜏᜅ᜔ ᜎᜒᜊᜓᜅ᜔ ᜋᜁᜃᜆ᜔ᜎᜓᜅ᜔ ᜆᜆ᜔ᜎᜓ᜶

In English, it translates to: the seventh of the third set [of tens], in the first month of the year two-thousand and the third of the third set [of tens].

In proper English, that is: the 27th of the 1st month, of the year 2000 and 23.

---

Based on: https://www.pilipino-express.com/history-a-culture/in-other-words/847-counting-the-old-way.html

#Philippines #PreColonial #PreHispanic #Alibata #ᜊᜌ᜔ᜊᜌᜒᜈ᜔

title: Charles Henry Turner: The little-known Black high school science teacher who revolutionized the study of insect behavior in the early 20th century

last_post.content:
Charles Henry Turner was a pioneer in entomology - and he couldn't get a job in higher ed, so he taught high school biology.

"Across his distinguished 33-year career, Turner authored 71 papers and was the first African American to have his research published in the prestigious journal Science."

His simple but elegant experiments in public parks revolutionized understanding of bees.

Chez les 0-19, la Covid est devenue la maladie infectieuse la plus mortelle.

Mais c'était très drôle cet été de dire le contraire.

Des journalistes lui ont parlé de cette étude pour avoir ses réactions?

https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamanetworkopen/fullarticle/2800816

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/Antagoniste_net/status/1621299714149810176

We're in Nature with an opinion piece on how researchers should respond to #ChatGPT and conversational AI technology more generally!

It's been an interesting experience to reach consensus in an interdisciplinary team of scholars (2 psychologists, 1 computer scientist, 1 philosopher and me, an NLP-er).

We list 5 priorities:
1. Hold on to human verification
2. Develop rules for accountability
3. Invest in truly open LLMs
4. Embrace the benefits of AI
5. Widen the debate

https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-00288-7

last_post.content:
More on space debris and the meaning of "environmentally responsible": https://spacenews.com/esa-seeks-global-adoption-of-zero-debris-policy/

Re-entry will likely deplete ozone: https://mastodon.online/@ProfHughLewis/109739856116413778

The marginal cost of leaving debris in orbit is rising in Q_debris due to collision risk (expected loss of sat services), while the marginal cost of deorbiting the debris is also rising in Q_debris due to ozone depletion. So what is the optimal amount of debris left in orbit? What must be true for it to be zero?

Jeg har selv vurdert å sette opp en instans som kan åpnes for brukere, men for tiden ser jeg at hele fediverset er overbelastet. Selskaper som tilbyr tjenester (feks mastohost) har selv også midlertidig stoppet å tilby drift av nye instanser. Tror vi må være litt tålmodige. Gradvis vil flaskehalsene løses. Ikke lett å erstatte arbeidet til 7500 heltidsansatte på kort tid :-)
